message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a source coding problem over a broadcast channel, which is a common topic in information theory (cs.IT) and network information theory (cs.NI). The use of directed graphs to represent the problem suggests that it may also fall under the category of graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS). The proposed encoding scheme and its complexity analysis may be of interest to researchers in coding theory and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper's focus on improving existing techniques for index coding suggests that it may also be relevant to researchers in machine learning and optimization (cs.LG).
